intro: Callista blanda, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features strap-like, grassy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Callista blanda is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
